data.title: "Explore" and "Search & destroy" orders
data.body:
"Explore" could order the selected unit(s) to move randomly to unknown parts of the map (or with a predefined pattern) in order to discover the map without having to do it manually. 
"Search & destroy" could do the same thing as "Explore", but with an attack-move order, useful to quickly find the last hidden MCV on the map.

data.title: Fix broken objectives fine-tuning
data.body:
As something in #6494 is broken.
Using

```
testobj = player.AddSecondaryObjective("xyz")
player.MarkCompletedObjective(testobj)
player.MarkFailedObjective(testobj)
```

(Objective should be failed)
gave me
![weirdobjectivesa](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/4442673/5ba89002-47e1-11e4-92fe-d0895bfce71c.png)
and using

```
testobj = player.AddSecondaryObjective("xyz")
player.MarkFailedObjective(testobj)
player.MarkCompletedObjective(testobj)
```

(Objective should stay failed)
as well.

data.title: Remove the MP tooltip row from campaign missions.
data.body: This is something that has always bugged me about the "recent" (2012 and later) singleplayer missions.  The player name and flag are not necessary in the sp missions (where each faction has a distinct color), and feel out of place.  Removing this row from the tooltip adds a bit of minor polish.

data.body:
https://github.com/LipkeGu/TSIniFiles/blob/master/ts-packages.zip

Use this only for Development time because we have no install logic for Firestorm :/

data.title: Build releases with latest Mono
data.body: Stolen from https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-build/pull/294 which will probably need to bake a little longer, but we can't wait till then. This will fix https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6597 and  https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6599 whose root may be a miscompile. Mono 2.10 is ancient and unsupported. We should stop using it to build releases. This will also improve performance on the generated IL code.

data.title: Spread damage is far too low on playtest-20140927
data.body: Most noticeable on nukes and pillbox MGs.

data.title: Fix Lua API interaction with destroyed actors
data.body:
This cleans up a couple of issues with the lua bindings:
- The bindings were regenerated each time an actor was bridged into lua (oops).
- The binding state (after fixing the above) becomes inconsistent based on whether the actor is first queried before or after it is destroyed.
- Undefined behaviour occurs commands are issued to destroyed actors via the Lua API.

The bindings will now unregister all but specifically marked property groups when an actor is destroyed, and the missing property error message will now mention that the actor is dead.

data.title: "Condition authorization to attack" option
data.body:
This option would act in a way that deny the player to directly attack the enemy base (just the defenses are allowed to attack units, in order to discourage any scout-cheating behavior), with a direct or force attack command, directed on enemy units and structures, until the timer has expired.

This would force the players to build up a compound, without being suddenly nagged by cocaine-haste enemies, or even just a quick-rushing AI, and instead provide the player enough time to build up all that is needed to fortify his base and things.

The time should be set while on the Mission selection options screen.

Some alternative versions of this option could include the harvesting of a particular amount of resources, before enable the authorization of attack, or some particular buildings (for example superweapons, like the Nuke Silo structure) or land units (for example Medium/Heavy Thanks or Mobile HQ, in case of particular PvP games). The lasts here, are just some brainstorming of mine, but I would not exclude them from consideration.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4915538-condition-authorization-to-attack-option?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: "Count-Limited On-Field units" option
data.body:
I have played BFME 2 recently and I have found that the units Count-Limit applied in the game, could be a nice thing, in order to avoid poor unit-rushing strategies, for who is more interested and focused on "strategy". Even because sometimes, you have little bases, that produce tons of units. This could be reasonable in particular types of PvP sessions, but not always and especially against the AI. For example, having a number of units potentially buildable, according to the dimension of the base you have built, would encourage the construction of more specific units, instead of just flood the enemy base. This would even try to emulate, some sort of TD game logic, where you didn't have so much resources and you had to think how to attack the enemy base, doing various strikes in order to cripple it, before the final rush.

I think this feature should be optional, and activable according the user preferences (of course).

According to the quantity of buildings placed by the player, or particular buildings (for example War Factories, Air Strips, Helipads), the number raise, until a max capped number. Otherwise, it would be nice have even an option to force-cap a number (while on the mission selection area) of maximum units created. This would open some new versions of PvP challenges, where players have to decide what exacly to use and in case, sell their exceeding useless units. 

It can even be conceived as another way of play the game, like deathmatch, capture the flag, king of the hill etc.

I have thought about this feature, even because its insertion in the game, would help people on creating Total Conversion mods, based on the OpenRA engine.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4915259-count-limited-on-field-units-option?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Engineers and Mechanics could defuse Tanya’s C4
data.body:
What if engineers and mechanics were able to automatically defuse Tanya’s C4 if they are adjacent to the target, or simply prevent her to put C4 on buildings and vehicles ?
If there is no engineer or mechanic Tanya can plant her C4 as usual but if they are there they will automatically defuse it (C4 defuse has higher priority than vehicle repair).
![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4431544/31b3d5c0-466c-11e4-8097-49d9481f7356.png)
![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4431547/3817b710-466c-11e4-9bae-1f910821409f.png)

data.title: Mechanics are too expensive or repair too slowly
data.body:
Distance :
A mechanic repairs a mammoth tank with low health (3-4 px left) in about 100 s.
A service depot repairs it in about 40 s.
Mammoth tanks seems to move from one cell to another in about 1,2 s.
From what disance to the service depot the mechanic will be more profitable than a round trip to the service depot ?
If my mammoth tank is at a distance of n cells to the service depot :
2_n_1.2+40>100
n > 25
So if the tank is at more than 25 cells from the service depot, it’s better to repair it with a mechanic.
Most of the maps have a size smaller than 100x100, so if you build a service depot at coordinates 25,25 (from any corner), mechanics become useless  on 25 % of a significant majority of map.
If you build a service depot at coordinates 25,25 from every corner, mechanics become useless on 100 % of these maps.

Cost :
Finally if I want effective mechanics I need to train more mechanics.
If 10 bazookas (the cheapest anti tank unit) come to attack my mammoth, I need around... 15 mechanics to maintain this tank alive, even if the tank shoots at the bazookas (tested, I don't know the exact numbers to calculate it accurately).
15 mechanics = 15*500$ = 7500 $ = 3,75 mammoth tanks.
If I had bought 4 mammoth tanks instead of 1 + 15 mechanics, the 4 mammoth tanks would have survived and killed all the bazookas (and I would have saved 1500 $).
In game you never have 15 mechanics per mammoth tank, so mechanics become useless again.
Less than 15 mechanics and the 10 bazookas kill the tank and the mechanics (14 \* 500 $ + 2000 $ = 9000 $ lost against 10 \* 300 $ = 3000 $).
![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4431539/076736c2-466c-11e4-8340-f3107ebb47d6.png)

On the above screenshot, you can see 7500 $ in the bottom left corner and 3000 $ in the top right corner. The 7500 $ are lost. If it was 4 mammoth tanks instead (1500 $ less and no mechanic), they would have won.

Mechanics with faster repair or lower cost ?

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4907024-mechanics-are-too-expensive-or-repair-too-slowly?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: A player should have lost only if he has lost everything
data.body:
If I have only one power plant left, I can sell it, get a soldier for the sell (my last “object” on the map), find a MCV crate with him, find a 1000$ crate too, rebuild a base, get all the technologies and produce a lot of mammoth tanks.
Lot of mammoth tanks from only one power plant left.
Unfortunately the game decided I lost when I sold the power plant.
